DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Gross Target Volume Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The measurement related to radiation therapy gross target volume.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Visible to the naked eye._The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container._An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Visible to the naked eye.:An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.:The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

Concepts.definition: An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
